snippet: The $8.5 billion CityCenter opened with much fanfare in the depths of the recession, but is only now benefiting from increasing numbers of visitors to the area.
abstract: CityCenter, $8.5 billion city within city of  Las Vegas,  is benefiting from increasing numbers of visitors after suffering through depths of the recession and surviving; 67-acre project, with nearly 2,400 high end condos, upscale shopping center and half a million square feet of retail space, opened in late 2009 to much fanfare but is now seen as a qualified success.
lead_paragraph: The $8.5 billion CityCenter opened with much fanfare in the depths of the recession, but is only now benefiting from increasing numbers of visitors to the area.

headline.seo: CityCenter in Las Vegas Survives a Case of Bad Timing
headline.main: Las Vegas Project Survives a Case of Bad Timing
headline.print_headline: Las Vegas Project Survives a Case of Bad Timing
